initiativeCore.problemStatement: Users need a browser-based web application to access their PC camera, view live feed, and capture photos and videos through a simple, intuitive interface.
goals: Enable users to activate their PC camera from within a web browser
Allow users to capture still photos from the camera feed in JPEG format
Allow users to record video from the camera feed in MP4 format
Support video recordings up to 30 minutes in length
Provide intuitive and easy-to-use interface for camera selection and capture
nonGoals: File formats other than JPEG (photos) and MP4 (videos)
Compliance with specific regulatory frameworks (HIPAA, GDPR data retention, etc.)
initiativeCore.businessImpact: Success enables users to perform basic media capture tasks directly in the browser without installing native applications, reducing friction and improving accessibility. Failure results in users seeking alternative solutions or abandoning the workflow entirely.
initiativeCore.stakeholders: Primary stakeholder: Initiative requester (self). End users requiring browser-based camera access, development team, QA team.

functional.description: Application must run in modern web browsers without requiring plugins or extensions
Provide a button to request and enable PC camera access
Display live camera feed in real-time once camera is enabled
Provide a photo capture button positioned to the right side of the camera feed
Provide a video capture button positioned below the camera feed
Capture and save still images in JPEG format when photo button is clicked
Start and stop video recording in MP4 format when video button is clicked
Automatically download captured photos to browser's default download folder
Automatically download recorded videos to browser's default download folder
Display visual feedback when camera is active
Handle camera permission denial gracefully with user messaging
Provide a camera selector dropdown displaying camera names when multiple cameras are available
Position camera selector above the capture buttons
Support video recordings up to 30 minutes maximum duration
Prevent video recording from exceeding 30-minute limit with appropriate user notification
Display recording duration timer during video capture
Allow users to switch between available cameras using the selector

nonFunctional.description: Camera feed must display with minimal latency (< 200ms)
Application must be compatible with Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge browsers
Interface must be responsive and usable on desktop screen sizes
Photo capture must complete within 1 second of button click
Video recording must support at least 720p resolution
Application must handle camera disconnection without crashing
UI must be intuitive and easy to use with minimal learning curve
Application must work over HTTPS connections only
JPEG photos must use standard compression with reasonable quality (80-90% quality)
MP4 videos must use H.264 codec for broad compatibility
Application must handle 30-minute video recordings without memory overflow or performance degradation
Camera switching must occur smoothly without requiring page reload

edgeCases: No camera device is available on the PC
Multiple cameras are connected to the PC
Camera is already in use by another application
Browser does not support MediaDevices API
User disconnects camera during active recording
Insufficient storage space for video recording
Browser tab loses focus during video recording
User attempts to capture photo while video is recording
User attempts to start new recording before previous video finishes downloading
Browser's download folder is inaccessible or has permission issues
User has disabled automatic downloads in browser settings
Camera selector shows duplicate camera names
Selected camera becomes unavailable after being chosen
Browser memory limits reached during long video recording
MP4 encoding fails or is not supported by browser
JPEG encoding produces corrupted image file

criteria.description: When user clicks enable camera button, browser prompts for camera permission
When camera permission is granted, live feed displays in the designated area
Photo capture button is visible and positioned to the right of the camera feed
Video capture button is visible and positioned below the camera feed
Clicking photo capture button produces a JPEG image from current feed
Clicking video capture button starts recording, clicking again stops recording and produces MP4 file
Captured JPEG photos automatically download to browser's default download folder
Recorded MP4 videos automatically download to browser's default download folder
Application displays appropriate error message when camera permission is denied
Application functions correctly in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge
Camera feed displays without noticeable lag or stuttering
Application handles camera disconnection without crashing
When multiple cameras are available, camera selector dropdown appears above capture buttons
Camera selector displays recognizable camera names for each available device
User can switch between cameras using selector without page reload
Video recording automatically stops at 30-minute mark with user notification
Application successfully records and downloads 30-minute video without errors
Interface is intuitive enough for first-time users to capture photo and video without instructions

measurableOutcomes: 100% of supported browsers successfully request camera permissions
Zero application crashes during camera disconnection scenarios
Cross-browser compatibility verified across 4 major browsers
100% of captured photos saved as valid JPEG files
100% of recorded videos saved as valid MP4 files
30-minute video recordings complete successfully without memory errors
All downloads automatically save to browser's default download folder

internalDependencies: Web development team availability within budget constraints
UI/UX design resources for intuitive interface layout

externalDependencies.name: Canvas API for JPEG image capture
Browser vendor support for media APIs
Browser's download mechanism and folder access

factors: Tight timeline (next week) may limit testing and refinement
30-minute video recording may strain browser memory management
MP4/H.264 encoding support varies across browsers
Camera enumeration and naming inconsistent across platforms
Browser download folder access may be blocked by user settings
Single stakeholder may result in limited user perspective
No compliance requirements simplifies implementation but may limit future use cases
mitigations: Prioritize MVP features for next week delivery, defer nice-to-have features
Implement memory-efficient video recording with chunked processing
Test MP4 encoding across all target browsers early, implement fallbacks if needed
Provide clear camera naming with fallback to device IDs
Implement user guidance for enabling browser downloads if blocked
Define clear scope boundaries to stay within weekly budget
Conduct quick usability test with 2-3 additional users before launch
Use MediaRecorder API with appropriate MIME type detection
Implement progressive download for long videos to avoid memory issues
Add recording duration warnings at 25 and 29 minutes
Test 30-minute recording scenario on lower-spec hardware

deliveryIntent.rolloutExpectations: Single release next week with core camera access, live feed display, camera selection, and photo/video capture functionality. Files automatically download as JPEG (photos) and MP4 (videos) to browser's default download folder. Support for up to 30-minute video recordings. Advanced features like editing, filters, or cloud storage deferred to future iterations.
deliveryIntent.timelineAssumptions: Target delivery: next week (approximately 5-7 calendar days). Assumes focused development sprint with daily progress checks. Timeline is aggressive and requires immediate start, dedicated resources, and minimal scope changes. Cross-browser testing must occur in parallel with development.
constraints: Must use browser-native APIs only (no plugins or extensions)
Requires HTTPS for camera access per browser security policies
Limited to desktop PC camera access (mobile out of scope)
Dependent on user granting camera permissions
Constrained by browser API support and compatibility variations
Photo format restricted to JPEG only
Video format restricted to MP4 only
Files must save to browser's default download folder (no custom location selection)
No regulatory compliance requirements to address
deliveryIntent.budget: $5000 per week (confirmed for initial development week)
